intro: Astragalus anthylloides, commonly known as the Sierra foothill milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus anthylloides plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
